Once the drop down box has been selected above the \'Select Frames\' button, it will show you all Frames that you have made prior. Select from the list and click the button to insert it into the Sequence. This will then give you the ability to select the amount of repetitions a Frame will have.

Once you have created your Sequence and no errors have occurred. You will be able to save your Sequence using the \'Save Sequence\' button. What your Sequence will look like, is displayed by a multitude of colours, indicating each Frame and its position.

After you have selected a Frame to use, you can select the Repetition Amount for that Frame. This indicates how many times the Frame will repeat before transitioning on to the next Frame in the Sequence.

Once the \'Remove Frames\' button has been pressed, it will remove all Frames selected from the Sequence. This is shown in the \'Sequence Creation Area\'. It will also allow you to re-add Frames again to the Sequence.

The \'Number of Frames\' button allows you to select from a drop-down selection, the Number of Frames you wish to use whilst creating your Sequence. This will then allow you to select from all the Frames you have made.
The \'Number the Sequence\' button assigns a number to your Sequence. This is also what your Sequence will be saved under and will be the unique value of that Sequence.

Select from a list of Frames that you have edited. This will allow you to re-make the Sequence without re-making the Frames again. Use the switch to switch between using the Edited Frames and Frames you made prior, at the start of creating your Sequence.

Select from the dropdown the speed of which you want the Pins to be activated for. This is measured as a length of time. This means that the Pins will stay out longer or shorter, depending on your selection.

This will select the Delay of each Pin, before they transfer on to the next Pin in the Frame. This is measured in a length of time, which means the Pins will be faster or slower to cycle to each next Pin depending on what you choose.
The \'Number the Frame\' button assigns a number to your Frame. This is also what your Frame will be saved under and will be the unique value of that Frame.
This will allow you to select how many Pins you wish to use in creating your Frame. If you select \'4\' then you can only tick \'4\' boxes in the 8x8 grid above.

Once you have created your Frame and no errors have occurred. You will be able to save your Frame using the \'Save Frame\' button. What your Frame will look like, is displayed by a number system, indicating the order in which the Pins will activate.
Select from a list of Frames, and if they are already saved on your device, you can load them. Once they are loaded, they can be edited and re-made how you see fit.

On this page, please select which User you are and also which Task you are completing. You will need to come back to this page before you start each new Task. If you need help understanding how to navigate around the Frame and Sequence Creation pages. Be sure to click the \'I\' icon for help.
